properties.areaDesc: San Juan County; Western Whatcom County; Western Skagit County
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 12 at 2:30AM PST until January 13 at 3:00AM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow and cold northeast winds will develop this
afternoon. Snow accumulation of 2 to 4 inches is expected with
blowing snow and wind gusts to 50 mph later today.

* WHERE...San Juan County, including Stuart Island, Waldron
Island, Orcas Island, San Juan Island, Lopez Island, Blakely
Island, and Decatur Island, Lowlands of western Whatcom
County, including Point Roberts, Lummi Island, Bellingham, and
Sumas and Lowlands of western Skagit County, including Cypress
Island, Guemes Island, Anacortes, Mount Vernon, and La Conner.

* WHEN...From noon today to 3 AM PST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Gusty winds could
bring down tree branches.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow amounts are highly uncertain however
even light snowfall can combine with windy conditions for
blowing snow and poor visibility. Low wind chills below zero
will develop tonight.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

For the latest road conditions in Washington state, call 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 3 AM PST MONDAY
